page.title: 14PASTURE MANAGEMENT
page.content:
{PASTURE} Some 35% of the total available farmland is dedicated to pasture and grazing, mostly short-term leys with an occasional tract of permanent meadowland.
The pasture provides either grazing for cattle and sheep or alternatively produces hay or silage for winter feed stock.
Silage production generally predominates and the 1/2 tonne round bales, sealed in large plastic bags for outdoor storage, are an increasingly common sight.
Hay is still produced in the smaller, more traditional rectangular bale format for storage under cover.
